segment.source: Configure access to Windows Store (Windows 10)
segment.target: Configure access to Windows Store (Windows 10)

segment.source: IT Pros can configure access to Windows Store for client computers in their organization.
segment.target: IT Pros can configure access to Windows Store for client computers in their organization.

segment.source: For some organizations, business policies require blocking access to Windows Store.
segment.target: For some organizations, business policies require blocking access to Windows Store.

segment.source: Configure access to Windows Store
segment.target: Configure access to Windows Store

segment.source: Applies to
segment.target: Applies to

segment.source: Windows 10
segment.target: Windows 10

segment.source: Windows 10 Mobile
segment.target: Windows 10 Mobile

segment.source: IT Pros can configure access to Windows Store for client computers in their organization.
segment.target: IT Pros can configure access to Windows Store for client computers in their organization.

segment.source: For some organizations, business policies require blocking access to Windows Store.
segment.target: For some organizations, business policies require blocking access to Windows Store.

segment.source: Options to configure access to Windows Store
segment.target: Options to configure access to Windows Store

segment.source: You can use these tools to configure access to Windows Store: AppLocker or Group Policy.
segment.target: You can use these tools to configure access to Windows Store: AppLocker or Group Policy.

segment.source: For Windows 10, this is only supported on Windows 10 Enterprise edition.
segment.target: For Windows 10, this is only supported on Windows 10 Enterprise edition.

segment.source: Block Windows Store using AppLocker
segment.target: Block Windows Store using AppLocker

segment.source: Applies to: Windows 10 Enterprise, Windows 10 Mobile
segment.target: Applies to: Windows 10 Enterprise, Windows 10 Mobile

segment.source: AppLocker provides policy-based access control management for applications.
segment.target: AppLocker provides policy-based access control management for applications.

segment.source: You can block access to Windows Store app with AppLocker by creating a rule for packaged apps.
segment.target: You can block access to Windows Store app with AppLocker by creating a rule for packaged apps.

segment.source: You'll give the name of the Windows Store app as the packaged app that you want to block from client computers.
segment.target: You'll give the name of the Windows Store app as the packaged app that you want to block from client computers.

segment.source: For more information on AppLocker, see What is AppLocker?
segment.target: For more information on AppLocker, see What is AppLocker?

segment.source: For more information on creating an AppLocker rule for app packages, see Create a rule for packaged apps.
segment.target: For more information on creating an AppLocker rule for app packages, see Create a rule for packaged apps.

segment.source: To block Windows Store using AppLocker
segment.target: To block Windows Store using AppLocker

segment.source: Type secpol in the search bar to find and start AppLocker.
segment.target: Type secpol in the search bar to find and start AppLocker.

segment.source: In the console tree of the snap-in, click Application Control Policies, click AppLocker, and then click Packaged app Rules.
segment.target: In the console tree of the snap-in, click Application Control Policies, click AppLocker, and then click Packaged app Rules.

segment.source: On the Action menu, or by right-clicking on Packaged app Rules, click Create New Rule.
segment.target: On the Action menu, or by right-clicking on Packaged app Rules, click Create New Rule.

segment.source: On Before You Begin, click Next.
segment.target: On Before You Begin, click Next.

segment.source: On Permissions, select the action (allow or deny) and the user or group that the rule should apply to, and then click Next.
segment.target: On Permissions, select the action (allow or deny) and the user or group that the rule should apply to, and then click Next.

segment.source: On Publisher, you can select Use an installed app package as a reference, and then click Select.
segment.target: On Publisher, you can select Use an installed app package as a reference, and then click Select.

segment.source: On Select applications, find and click Store under Applications column, and then click OK.
segment.target: On Select applications, find and click Store under Applications column, and then click OK.

segment.source: Click Next.
segment.target: Click Next.

segment.source: Create a rule for packaged apps has more information on reference options and setting the scope on packaged app rules.
segment.target: Create a rule for packaged apps has more information on reference options and setting the scope on packaged app rules.

segment.source: Optional: On Exceptions, specify conditions by which to exclude files from being affected by the rule.
segment.target: Optional: On Exceptions, specify conditions by which to exclude files from being affected by the rule.

segment.source: This allows you to add exceptions based on the same rule reference and rule scope as you set before.
segment.target: This allows you to add exceptions based on the same rule reference and rule scope as you set before.

segment.source: Click Next.
segment.target: Click Next.

segment.source: Block Windows Store using Group Policy
segment.target: Block Windows Store using Group Policy

segment.source: Applies to: Windows 10 Enterprise, version 1511
segment.target: Applies to: Windows 10 Enterprise, version 1511

segment.source: You can also use Group Policy to manage access to Windows Store.
segment.target: You can also use Group Policy to manage access to Windows Store.

segment.source: To block Windows Store using Group Policy
segment.target: To block Windows Store using Group Policy

segment.source: Type gpedit in the search bar to find and start Group Policy Editor.
segment.target: Type gpedit in the search bar to find and start Group Policy Editor.

segment.source: In the console tree of the snap-in, click Computer Configuration, click Administrative Templates , click Windows Components, and then click Store.
segment.target: In the console tree of the snap-in, click Computer Configuration, click Administrative Templates , click Windows Components, and then click Store.

segment.source: In the Setting pane, click Turn off Store application, and then click Edit policy setting.
segment.target: In the Setting pane, click Turn off Store application, and then click Edit policy setting.

segment.source: On the Turn off Store application setting page, click Enabled, and then click OK.
segment.target: On the Turn off Store application setting page, click Enabled, and then click OK.

segment.source: Block Windows Store using management tool
segment.target: Block Windows Store using management tool

segment.source: Applies to: Windows 10 Mobile
segment.target: Applies to: Windows 10 Mobile

segment.source: If you have mobile devices in your organization that you upgraded from earlier versions of Windows Phone 8 to Windows 10 Mobile, existing policies created using the Windows Phone 8.1 configuration service providers (CSP) with your MDM tool will continue to work on Windows 10 Mobile.
segment.target: If you have mobile devices in your organization that you upgraded from earlier versions of Windows Phone 8 to Windows 10 Mobile, existing policies created using the Windows Phone 8.1 configuration service providers (CSP) with your MDM tool will continue to work on Windows 10 Mobile.

segment.source: If you are starting with Windows 10 Mobile, we recommend using AppLocker to manage access to Windows Store app.
segment.target: If you are starting with Windows 10 Mobile, we recommend using AppLocker to manage access to Windows Store app.

segment.source: When your MDM tool supports Windows Store for Business, the MDM can use these CSPs to block Windows Store app:
segment.target: When your MDM tool supports Windows Store for Business, the MDM can use these CSPs to block Windows Store app:

segment.source: Policy
segment.target: Policy

segment.source: EnterpriseAssignedAccess (Windows 10 Mobile, only)
segment.target: EnterpriseAssignedAccess (Windows 10 Mobile, only)

segment.source: For more information, see Configure an MDM provider.
segment.target: For more information, see Configure an MDM provider.
